alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 9:36AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following county...Bucks. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 935 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain due to thunderstorms has ended, although showers will continue for another hour or two. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Newtown, Langhorne, Richboro, Langhorn, Woodside, Gardenville, Levittown, Penndel, Langhorne Manor, Hulmeville, Newtown Grant, and Village Shires. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 353 and 355. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 37. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
